channel.title: NPR Topics: Business
channel.description: Find the latest business news with reports on Wall Street, interest rates, banking, companies, and U.S. and world financial markets. Subscribe to the Business Story of the Day podcast.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: U.S. unexpectedly adds 130,000 jobs in January after a weak 2025
item.description: U.S. employers added 130,000 jobs in January as the unemployment rate dipped to 4.3% from 4.4% in December. Annual revisions show that job growth last year was far weaker than initially reported.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. employers added 130,000 jobs in January as the unemployment rate dipped to 4.3% from 4.4% in December. Annual revisions show that job growth last year was far weaker than initially reported.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: How much power does the Fed chair really have?
item.description: On paper, the Fed chair is just one vote among many. In practice, the job carries far more influence. We analyze what gives the Fed chair power.
item.content:encoded:
On paper, the Fed chair is just one vote among many. In practice, the job carries far more influence. We analyze what gives the Fed chair power.

(Image credit: JIM WATSON)
item.dc:creator: Greg Rosalsky

item.title: Sidewalk delivery robots are colonizing city sidewalks and raising concerns
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with Ainsley Harris, senior writer at Fast Company, about the accelerated rollout of delivery robots and how they're being received in communities across the country.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with Ainsley Harris, senior writer at Fast Company, about the accelerated rollout of delivery robots and how they're being received in communities across the country.
item.dc:creator: Jason Fuller

item.title: A shadowy industry is helping small businesses pay tariffs — at a high cost
item.description: How about $350,000 within hours? The pitches flood small businesses: "No hidden fees, No BS." These financial lifelines are barely regulated and can turn into trip wires.
item.content:encoded:
How about $350,000 within hours? The pitches flood small businesses: "No hidden fees, No BS." These financial lifelines are barely regulated and can turn into trip wires.

(Image credit: Cornell Watson for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh

item.title: Days after mass layoffs, Washington Post CEO steps down
item.description: Washington Post publisher and CEO Will Lewis stepped down late Saturday, days after the newspaper cut a third of the staff.
item.content:encoded: Washington Post publisher and CEO Will Lewis stepped down late Saturday, days after the newspaper cut a third of the staff.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: 'Washington Post' CEO departs after going AWOL during massive job cuts
item.description: Washington Post chief executive and publisher Will Lewis has departed just days after the newspaper announced massive layoffs.
item.content:encoded:
Washington Post chief executive and publisher Will Lewis has departed just days after the newspaper announced massive layoffs.

(Image credit: Allison Robbert)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Trump promised a crypto revolution. So why is bitcoin crashing?
item.description: Trump got elected promising to usher in a crypto revolution. More than a year later, bitcoin's price has come tumbling down. What happened?
item.content:encoded:
Trump got elected promising to usher in a crypto revolution. More than a year later, bitcoin's price has come tumbling down. What happened?

(Image credit: Mark Humphrey)
item.dc:creator: Rafael Nam

item.title: DVDs and public transit: Boycott drives people to ditch Big Tech to protest ICE
item.description: A sweeping boycott has begun — targeting tech giants who participants believe are enabling President Trump and his immigration crackdown.
item.content:encoded:
A sweeping boycott has begun — targeting tech giants who participants believe are enabling President Trump and his immigration crackdown.

(Image credit: John Moore)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Goodbye, Minute Maid frozen juices
item.description: Coca-Cola, which owns Minute Maid, has announced it will discontinue its line of frozen juice concentrates, which have been a staple in many American homes over the past 80 years.
item.content:encoded: Coca-Cola, which owns Minute Maid, has announced it will discontinue its line of frozen juice concentrates, which have been a staple in many American homes over the past 80 years.
item.dc:creator: Marc Rivers

item.title: Wall Street's latest wild week
item.description: The Nasdaq had its worst days since April's tariff turmoil, as investor worries mounted about an AI bubble -- but there were some non-tech bright spots.
item.content:encoded: The Nasdaq had its worst days since April's tariff turmoil, as investor worries mounted about an AI bubble -- but there were some non-tech bright spots.
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan
